case_vignette: a 25-year-old man with no remarkable past medical history presents with an itchy rash on the feet. symptoms began 2 months ago, starting over the dorsal toes with redness, scaling, and itching. the eruption spread over the dorsum of the feet and progressed to weeping and crusting. he reports recently buying new shoes for work as a chef, which requires 15 hours daily of standing. due to profuse sweating, his socks become soaked daily. examination reveals symmetric erythematous plaques over the bilateral dorsum of both feet with fissures, scaling, and lichenification. no blisters or vesicles are present, but there are scattered crusted erosions.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have an itchy rash on my feet with redness, scaling, and it's been weeping and crusting.
How long have you had these symptoms?
The symptoms began 2 months ago.
Do you have any allergies, or any other medical conditions?
No, I have no remarkable past medical history.
Have you had a similar rash in the past?
No, I haven't had a similar rash in the past.
Have you been in contact with any new substances or been in a new environment recently?
Yes, I recently bought new shoes for work.
Do you notice any improvement or worsening of the symptoms when you stop wearing those shoes?
I haven't mentioned stopping the use of the shoes, so I can't confirm if there's any improvement or worsening when I don't wear them.
Have you tried any treatments or medications for the rash so far?
No, I haven't tried any treatments or medications for the rash so far.
Final Diagnosis: Contact dermatitis
